author: {'steamid': '76561197985672769', 'num_games_owned': 1824, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1704926629}
review:
Random Scuffed Games #94
twitch.tv/DitoMido

Vorgeschlagen von: Maskedflow

Ach du heiligs blechle! ich bin gerade mal level 3 nach einer Stunde und hart verzweifelt. Das Spiel ist wirklich Sackenschwer und am Ende hab ich mir einfach den Rythmus eingeprägt, weil ich sonst nicht mehr weitergekommen bin. Blöd nur, dass ich kein gutes Rythmusgefühl habe haha
Konzept ist nice, auch wenn die Lernkurve hier wirklich steil ist. Die Grafik ist wirklich sehr simpel aber ästhetisch und die Musik ganz ok. Die Challenge Modi hätten evtl. noch variationsreicher sein können.
Für Casual Masochismus kommt man für einen Euro glaube ich nicht günstiger weg.
Das Spiel ist auf jedenfall genau das was es verspricht, also achtet auf die Tags und die Beschreibung!

Rating:
Dito: 4.7/5
Chat: 3.18/5
Gesamt: 3.94/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198022041905', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1660584483}
review:
I really wanted to like this game, but the difficulty curve is just insane, and not in the good way: I'd know what to do, but physically making the inputs in time was the hard part. 

Levels 1 and 2 are fine, but by level 3 the game felt more like an APM test than anything. 

If you like to be brutalised by games, go ahead and pick this one up, because that's what it does to you. If mere challenge isn't enough, and you actually want to have fun during the process... I'd pass on this one.

review: My head hurts from trying to play this game. I don't think anything ever has managed to give me motion sickness before, until I played the green and red levels. I just want 1 achievement, but I cannot spend more than 10 mins on the endless red level without getting a headache. Haha world go spinny, owie. Apart from the world spinning around me rn, this game isn't that bad. Would give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105090854', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1690284526}
review:
Give me my 5 hours back.
4 base levels are very short and kinda pointless (just memorization and tight timings, nothing too impressive), 4 drunk levels are just a visual challenge of previous levels (same thing but you see less, LOL).

Endless mode was promising at first, a great field to train your pattern recognition and mucle memory... Except fuck your pattern recognition - the screen itself after 50 points starts to spin so fast that I feel like I am looking at the washing mashine (motion sickness warning) and fuck your muscle memory - the speed increases as you progress so you can't use the same clicks you were using 30 points back.
Getting to 100pts was way too frustrating and not fun, and even looked like random after 90.

Play geometry dash if you want something endless with click timing and memorization.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450345569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1689136201}
review:
i review games on steam after i 100% complete them! check out my reviews to see all the games i have completed!

oO is an arcade/puzzle game developed and published by maciej targoni. it released may 20th, 2015 on steam and is targoni's second game published to steam, following hook's release earlier in the year. the main goal is controlling a ball as it moves around the circumference of interconnected circles. you can shift from the interior to the exterior of the circle and vice versa. you dodge obstacles as you try to finish all the levels. it's fairly simple, but all of targoni's games are. it's easy to learn, but hard to master, making the game fun and frustrating at the same time. you'll need a quick reaction time if you want to complete this game. the endless mode acts as a way to provide replay-ability after completing the rest of the game. it's funny seeing negative reactions/reviews for this game as it's clearly just people that couldn't pass a certain level or just couldn't get going at all. i definitely recommend this, especially when it's on sale. i wouldn't really say you have to wait for a sale, as the game is only a dollar for full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118334485', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1662485503}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1709941488}
review:
"oO" is a mobile app that's been dumped on Steam as if it was a real PC game (it's not)... it's a cash grab from greedy mobile devs.  The game is a simple, shallow one-button action/reflaxes game where you press a button to make a ball flip from the inside to the outside of a circle or vice versa.  If you let the ball hit an obstacle, you die.  To complete each level you need to "flip" the ball between the series of connected circles that make up the level.  That's all there is to it.  Well, this is exactly the kind of thing mobile peasants love to play on their iPhones. 

From a technical perspective, as a mobile app, this doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no option to change the resolution and no useful graphics tweaks.  There's no way to ensure this is running at the native resolution of your display.  There's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.

The mobile app features extremely lazy, minimalist "art", of the type you normally expect to see in low effort Flash/browser games and mobile apps.  Considering this is being evaluated as a PC game, having the graphics phoned in like this isn't going to result in a high quality, visually impressive game that PC gamers are used to seeing.

The controls can't be customised because the game has such a dumbed down, simplified interface that it's just iPhone screen tapping stuff.  The fact that the interface is this dumbed down might be seen as a problem in itself, however... this is a fairly shallow experience if you're the kind of gamer that likes to play games with deep, rich control schemes and interaction.  You'll get none of that here.

Because this is a mobile app, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies.  Compromises were made to cater to the iPhones that the mobile app was designed for.  These are unfortunate handicaps and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was an afterthought for the iPhone developers who are to blame for this.  The mobile app is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for mobile phones forces upon a game.  Once more, mobile devs have made gaming worse for everyone.  I didn't spend thousands on building a gaming rig just so I could pretend it's an iPhone.

These technical defects push this mobile app below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

"oO" is relatively cheap at $1 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the mobile app, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035276767', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1617520159}
review:
[b] Achievements. Pain. [/b]

[h1] The Game [/h1]
A simple little hardcore game where you jump between circles.

[h1] The Achievements [/h1]
There are 2 types of achievements: beat all of the levels and reach level 100 in endless mode. It can become very, very difficult as the whole screen starts rotating faster and faster. Extremely skill  based but my completion time was 11.6 hours. 

[h1] Recommendation [/h1]
It is entirely up to you if you want to try it but it falls under the category "very difficult". Some can complete it very fast and others it will take several hours. I would recommend to watch some gameplay and judge for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054476162', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 982, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1672360284}
review:
[h1]反射神経でもいけるがリズムでもいける[/h1]
円周の内側と外側を移動して障害物を避けながらゴールを目指すゲーム。マウスやスペースだけで遊べてお手軽。分かっていても押せなかったり、逆に待たなければ行けないのに押しちゃったりと良い感覚がある。コースを覚えつつ反射神経でプレイは可能だが、ステージの動きも一定なのでリズムでもいける。なんとなく、リズムも想定済みなタイミングに思える。

価格も安く、お手軽にストレスとそれを乗り切った時の爽快感を味わえるのでおすすめ。

Overall Score: 4/10

Wouldn't necessarily not recommend it, but there is no mixed review so I think I will just set it as negative. Pretty barebones reaction/score based game where you simply press space to flip your circle, in an attempt to make it through the obstacles. It's cheap so if you are interested could try it out but I think there are for sure better games in the genre that are a lot better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996899722', 'num_games_owned': 1440, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1664286234}
review:
Far too hard.  An exercise in frustration.   The dev has made a great puzzler, but the difficulty is way too high to be enjoyable.    Have come back to this so many times, but I'm giving up.   The ball needs slowed down.  

I shouldn't be raging angry by stage 3, that should be delayed until stage 8 or 9 when I'm invested in it.   

Avoid, unless you have lightning reflexes and a high tolerance for annoyance.

author: {'steamid': '76561199215426797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1695542537}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

review:
一款很簡易，但玩起來很難的小遊戲！很吃反應力＆判斷力。
遊戲玩法就很簡單的換位子，圈內圈外一直轉換，要避開障礙物~到後面關卡圈圈還會變形蠕動、障礙物也會變化移動，就變形這方面來說很傷眼睛...不過好處是存檔點很多，容錯率算大的精準遊戲。

author: {'steamid': '76561198261326127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1670985535}
review:
For idiots who think that this game is frustrating and difficult: go play VVVVVV, you'll die a lot more than even level 4+ of this game. I finished oO in less than 40 minutes from start to finish, (excluding infinite modes of course). My deaths count is: 9, 16, 33, 36, 82, 70 (yes the wobbly was actually easier  on this one since I was familiar with what to expect already), 136, 140. If you have serious trouble with this game, get off social media. It wears down your cognitive abilities including focus and patience, both of which are necessary for this game.

Overall, the game is excellent. It's simple but to the point. It's challenging but not frustratingly so. Maybe because I'm a musician, but the main challenge of the levels are in the observation and planning, not in the timing. If you don't use your brains, then yes, it's crazily difficult. So use your brains.

author: {'steamid': '76561198857917238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1674261561}
review:
oO es un gran juego de precision parecido a juegos como geometry dash y A dance of fire and ice, tiene una buena cantidad de niveles añadiendo tambien un modo infinito... Pero tiene 2 defectos

1) A pesar de tener una buena-media cantidad de niveles el juego puede completarse en poco tiempo.
2) El modo infinito no se genera proceduralmente o randomly generated por lo que los obstaculos y figuras siempre seran las mismas.

La calificacion final que le doy es un 8.5/10 esas 5 decimas extra le dan puntos a favor  por el precio pero los 2 defectos que tiene lo dejan en 8. PEROOOOO aun asi te recomiendo que lo compres y lo añadas a tu coleccion de juegos estilo geometry dash, a dance of fire and ice entre otros :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198036538203', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1629929906}
review:
I obviously haven't managed to beat Oo all the way through as of typing this review. However, I have formed an opinion I want to share.

Oo's premise is very much as simple as it looks. A hypothetical world is portrayed of mathematical grid spaces, with conjoined rings floating around, along with a white dot for each. Us players are given control of the white dots in only one way: At the click of the mouse or the press of a key, the dot will switch sides of the circle it is on. This is used to progress, and as the rings progress, to dodge obstacles. There is no story; why these white dots just want to get to the other side is up to ourselves to speculate.

This mere, simple premise is used to impressive effect. Switching sides on a circle feels satisfying, even in the simple case of an obstacle-free transfer. Every obstacle setup is possible indeed to clear, if you're willing to put the time into it. Clearing each stage seems to be a matter of timing, memory, and self-control, and it can be engaging to build this up.

Thankfully, this game is merciful. You are not forced to work with a finite number of lives except in endless mode. The player can lose as many white dots as she or he wants to and keep going; the skill measure is that a count of how many dots it takes to reach the end of each stage is kept after clearing, and the circles showing each stage show the minimum number you've succeeded with.

Best of all, and most importantly in my opinion: This game saves your progress and lets you come back. Each stage has multiple check-point rings. If you exit a stage you haven't completed, then the game itself, then boot the game up later and click the same stage, you will start at the last checkpoint ring you reached.

This one feature makes what would be a far-too-cruel game into an engaging and fair experience where we can just focus on quizzing our own memory, reflexes, and timing- and have fun doing it.

--

For its simplicity I for one feel like I'm getting well more than my money's worth in gameplay experience. If you're curious and you'd rather test your timing and memory than eat and forget a candy bar, I recommend giving oO a try. If you're particularly frugal, a sale to bring the price down to 89 cents can empower this already-fair deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175493990', 'num_games_owned': 2383, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1608141749}
review:
[h1]Harcore a moda antiga![/h1]

[b]oO[/b] é um jogo de reflexos, onde o objetivo é andar pelos círculos desviando de obstáculos, fazendo isso transitando entre o interior e exterior deles.
O ritmo é frenético. Você vai passar raiva em muitos momentos. Porém a música e mecânica fazem o jogo ser viciante a ponto de você querer tentar várias vezes até enjoar.

Recomendo como um jogo casual.

review: 看起来不仅玩音游会手癖，玩oo也会手癖。。。有的关卡一旦形成错误的反应记忆就很难改回来了呜呜呜。。。在第三关挣扎中。。。不过第一眼看到这种简约风就很爱

author: {'steamid': '76561198155370610', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1612522518}
review:
Хардкорная игрушка из разряда "умри 100 раз, чтобы пройти одно место". Не особо люблю подобное, но эта игра понравилась своей уникальной идеей и шикарным минимализмом, да и цена не кусается. С каждым новым уровнем добавляются всё новые интересные механики, неплохо разбавляя геймплей. Отдельного упоминания стоит бесконечный режим, после 60 игра разгоняется до таких космических скоростей, что требует максимальной концентрации и сосредоточенности, при чём каждый забег уникальный, нельзя запомнить определённые паттерны, нужно вытаскивать чисто на реакции. Любителям подобного хардкора советую, тем, кому надоело спокойно жить тоже ;D

P. S. Вернулся в игру спустя время, на результат 100 в бесконечном режиме ушло 9 часов, хотя по началу казалось вообще нереальным. Всем, кто будет ещё пробовать планку в 100+ удачи и терпения!

author: {'steamid': '76561198343052428', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1612886676}
review: 全成就达成，耗时4.5h，毫无疑问最难的成就无尽模式达到100，虽然很难但是熟悉套路之后加上随机应变与一些运气就可以过，主线4关很好玩，3,4关虽然比较难，但是档很短，只要找到方法都可以通关，无尽模式虽然比较单调，但是后期也非常刺激，而且无尽模式如果还有一堆花样的话那难度就过高了，至于扭扭扭模式。。。实在是太瞎了，不想玩，只把第一关的过了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198412476888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1600821354}
review:
[b]Summary:[/b]
[i]oO[/i] is a simple game where a ball must navigate obstacles by flipping between the inside and outside of connected rings. I found it tedious and did not enjoy it.

[b]My Experience:[/b]
This game is very simple - when you press a button, the ball flips to the other side of the current ring. You advance through the level by flipping into another ring. 

It reminds me of mobile games, with controls that are suited for touch, simple goals, and repetitive gameplay. That's not necessarily negative, but I found it fell into the same traps as many viral mobile games - namely, I quickly got bored. There's enjoyment here for those who like that genre, but it wore my nerves thin in just a few minutes. 

[b]My Recommendation:[/b]
I don't really recommend this because I found it tedious. However, you may still enjoy it!

In my opinion, there are far more enjoyable games to get for the same price (including [i]Hook[/i], or even [i]One Finger Death Punch[/i] if it's on sale), so I urge you to try one of those instead.

The impOsed labOriOusness of oO, thOugh OminOus upOn first glance, is cOunterbalanced with lOads Of enjOyale trial and errOr, and an Overbearing, unending urge tO cOmplete the Olympic task Of cOnquering this glOriOus Orbicular reflex/timing game. oO is Out Of this wOrld!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198161937588', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1596739476}
review: Давно взял по приколу, но конкретно руки дошли только сейчас. Что можно сказать, минимализм во всем в меню, в управлении (пробел или ЛКМ), и в геймплее, надо всего лишь перескакивать во время в соседние кружки. Эта игра может принести как жопоболь, так и гордость, что ты смог пройти уровень или набить рекорд в бесконечном режиме. Оценочка игре 9 кружочков из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160278225', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 6223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1617966806}
review:
ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ:
Вам надо нажимать одну кнопку, передвигая шарик с круга на круг. Вам предстоит пройти через препятствия, до конца уровня. Самый последний уровень - бесконечный. Там нету сохранений, и вы играете на рекорд.

ПЛЮСЫ:
1. Уникальная аркада, не встречал подобных.
2. Много уровней.
3. Хорошая музыка.
4. Можно играть одной рукой.
5. Цена.
6. Мало занимает места.

МИНУСЫ:
1. Мой попец летит где-то над сатурном...

Моя оценка: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198090433209', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1593467832}
review:
The game is more frustrating than it is fun, which is not a sentiment I share about similar games like Super Hexagon or Velocibox. 

Still, the game's only a dollar, and there is [i] some [/i] fun to be had, so I think it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199054936508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1591717333}
review:
这款游戏实在是太有趣了呢！
不仅能帮你锻炼手臂肌肉，还能实时搞崩你的心态
hhhhhh
没看测评之前以为圈圈里面的数字是自己过了多少个圆圈
看着数字越来越大，还以为自己越来越厉害了呢
没想到是死亡数。。。。
渣渣实锤。。醉了醉了
虽然这款游戏很自虐
但是为什么我玩的时候一直想笑hhhhhhh
可能是误打误撞一气呵成的赞叹！也可能是重来N次还是没过的无奈。。
反正挺有意思的哈哈哈哈哈哈哈

author: {'steamid': '76561198169763629', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1587125785}
review:
[h1]ストレス溜まるが何故かはまる[/h1]
[table][tr][td]
システム
[/td][td]

エンドレスがえげつねぇのです・・・。
[/td][/tr][tr][td]
実績
[/td]
[td]
5/6（1時間）
[/td][/tr][tr][td]
ご参考
[/td][td]

[/td][/tr][/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198023838421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1566926688}
review:
Я бы сказал, что это кликер. Но не тот, который обещает сделать тебя мультимиллиардером, владельцем заводов, газет, пароходов или суперкрутого войска для борьбы с нечистью. Игра на первый взгляд проста до безобразия: знай себе нажимай вовремя на ЛКМ... Но на практике это оказывается чертовски непросто! Игра затягивает, потому что в какой-то момент ты начинаешь думать: "да неужели я мышкой пользоваться не умею?!" И сидишь потом часами кликаешь в надежде выбить все достижения... У меня на это ушел 21 час, размазанный на три года :)
Настоятельно рекомендую как дешевую альтернативу какому-нибудь getting-over-it'у. Сгореть и в этой игре можно капитально. И мышь сломать тоже)))

author: {'steamid': '76561197984548551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1612826537}

author: {'steamid': '76561198197126005', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1641589051}
review:
Gra zręcznościowa dla ludzi o mocnych nerwach. Jesteśmy małą kuleczką, która przemierza swą trasę przez okręgi z kolcami. Zakańczamy swą podróż, gdy dojdziemy do charakterystycznego czarnego kółka. Poziomów jest podajże nie zbyt wiele, lecz z każdym dalszym poziomem jest jeszcze ciężej. W pewnym momencie można odblokować rozgrywkę z czasem (Bardzo dobre na udoskonalenie swojego refleksu) umożliwiającą bicie własnego rekordu dalej i dalej... 
-----------------------------------------
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028839648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1506283647}
review:
Very nice concept. Good time killer. Requires quite a focus from the player. In some points I felt that the game was lacking on the precission which was asking from the player(I felt there was slight lag on key press) and that creates these extreme spikes in difficulty in comparison to the rest of the level. 
There also seems to be some bug with precission in game rendering/collision detection (mostly appears when you let the game run for longer amount of time), which makes the spikes on circles appear a little bit on the other side of the circle and they can still hit you from that side.
Despite that, would I recommend this game? Yes. Especially when it's on sale for 0.66€ .

author: {'steamid': '76561198122258825', 'num_games_owned': 3711, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1595557821}
review:
[list][*][b][h1]Morlan's shorts:[/h1][/b][/list]
Hard minimalistic coordination game.. Clicking (or button push) will flip your wee blob on the other side of the line and follow that side's route. Effectively it will jump to the next circle if the switch happens at the intersection of two circle. Avoid [b]everything[/b] but clean..air, in your path, and you'll move on..survive a few seconds more or manage the level!
It's hard, frustrating (you need very good reflexes) and will probably make you rage quit.. But it's fun with a nice soundtrack and it's well made (apart for the fact that it has no sizeable window mode or no volume sliders)
There's an endless mode too.. Nooooo!!

[b]Don't waste more time reading lengthy reviews.. time is of the essence![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198068341928', 'num_games_owned': 750, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1662548813}
review:
[h1]oO shouldn't exist on PC[/h1]
Let's make it clear. Devs doesn't lie when they tell you the game is "hardcore". The placing of circles is sometimes so terrible you have to hit the spacebar or LMB perfectly in time to progress. The game also lacks in achievements. There are 4 levels and Endless Mode, each having additional "Nightmare Mode" which not only makes your head hurt, but you also don't get an achievement for completing them. Menu graphics are terribly made and looks like something from free Unity Assets.

 [h1]Pros:[/h1]
+ Really easy controls
+ Endless Mode
+ That's all

 [h1]Cons:[/h1]
- Strings of small circles, where ball moves really fast
- Nightmare mode, that makes your head hurt, gives no achievements, and for some reason Hud is unreadable in it
- Hard to beat levels, because you often have to click perfectly to get to the next area
- Menu looks like it's using Free Unity Assets
- Game idea probably stolen from mobile game called Orbits (the earliest review I could find is from May 6th of 2015). 
- Game often want you to get through the area of circles without waiting, but then gives you right away areas when you have to wait for spikes to hide
- Music in Endless Mode can get so intense that you can't hear it
- Endless Mode is basically Race against Time, you can't stop on any circle, because you are chased by a red zone (it's so red it hurts your eyes)

 [h1]Summary[/h1]
I love other games from this developers, but this one isn't the best. From me this game gets [spoiler]2/10[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198094652712', 'num_games_owned': 874, 'num_reviews': 453, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1461267377}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1543048905}
review:
"oO" ist ein kleines Eintasten-Timing-Spiel.

Das Grundprinzip ist simpel. Ein Ball rollt in der Innenseite eines Kreises. Mit einem Tastendruck springt dieser entweder auf einen angrenzenden Kreis oder auf die Außenseite des ersten Kreises. Ziel ist es einen Parcour von aneinanderhängenden Kreisen zu bestehen.

Nach ein paar Kreisen kommt immer wieder ein Speicherpunkt. Der ist auch ziemlich schnell bitter nötig, denn das Game hat einen stark ansteigenden Schwierigkeitsgrad. Tödliche Stacheln, die teils sogar rhythmisch auftauchen oder selbst durch den Kreis rollen machen uns das Leben schwer. Zudem dreht auch gerne mal die Perspektive. Und so wird das Spielchen recht schnell zu einem herausfordernden Timing-Marathon, der schnelle Reaktionsfähigkeit verlangt.

Das geometrische Design ist simpel aber ästhetisch gelungen und zum Spielprinzip passend. Der treibende, immer schneller werdende Sound unterstützt die Atmosphäre.

Ein minimalistisches Gelegenheitsspiel, das weder lang noch besonders abwechslungsreich ist, das aber fordert und unterhält. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 Atmosphäre
-/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
6/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
7/10 Balancing
7/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
oO ist eine runde Sache.

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198213264121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1711038716}
review:
艰苦奋斗几小时终于全成就撒花^_^（强迫症表示十分满足）。这是一群简朴而又十分具有挑战性的圈圈，按键简单，不过经常在同一个地方听到小球碎裂声真的要疯掉，尤其后两关的连续小圈圈，简直不要太酸爽。当然还不仅仅如此，当我打开扭曲模式时，我不禁自问，到底是什么样的动力让我买下这个游戏（滑稽）

哈哈言归正传，个人认为还是十分有趣的，无聊时拿出来玩玩无尽模式听听音乐[strike]放松放松[/strike]，说不定不经意中就到100圈成就呢。不过遗憾的是关卡还是略微少了一些，但总体来说是一款不错的[strike]休闲[/strike]小游戏。

[spoiler]（温馨提示：请准备好一堆鼠标或者一群备用空格键）[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198360404194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1644333613}
review:
这游戏真的是喜欢的人喜欢的不行，不感兴趣的觉得没意思。
说说我的感觉吧：这游戏除了生存模式通关四个模式的话用了我5个小时左右的游戏时间（是间断的，身体需要休息），通了四个模式之后真的是不想在玩。不幸的是我打开的生存模式，，，之后我就停不下来了，音乐好听。
说说生存模式，一开始20min打到10圈吧。不知道打了多久到了35以上就已经太快了，但是很爽，感觉有点大脑高潮的感觉，很带劲！！！
总之很推荐这个游戏，刺激神经！！

review:
リズムに乗る死にゲー
基本4ステージは死にまくって覚えるゲームなので反射神経は全く要らない
ただ最後にアンロックされるエンドレスモードは
スーパーヘキサゴンばりに画面回転しだしたりAパターンBパターンCパターンみたいに幾つかあるから
リズムだけで覚えて行っても反射神経がある程度ないと臨機応変に対応できないため限界が来る
FPSとかRTSの肩慣らしというか、反射神経試しとか直感的に操作するのの練習とかにおすすめできるゲーム

author: {'steamid': '76561198025676875', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1637605355}
review:
Well, you've created a challenging, artistic game, which I'm sure required a lot of careful timing and precision to make work. But you forgot something very important: It's not FUN.

This game's 'unique' mix of frenzied reactions, very specific timing, memorization, and idle waiting completely fails to create a cohesive, enjoyable experience. I would not recommend playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288737855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1526102152}
review:
I bought this on the strength of Hook, by the same folks, and it's entirely different but similarly quick to pick up.

Unlike Hook, this is a twitch game, and it can get a bit frantic. The concept is incredibly creative and just like Hook, the execution is beautiful. It feels solid and smooth. I'm enjoying it, and it's remarkably inexpensive for the fun I'm getting out of it.

review: Великолепная игра для  проверки своей реакции. Управление простое- нажимать вовремя всего лишь одну кнопку (Пробел на клаве или ЛКМ на мыши).Смерть в игре постоянна, но совсем безобидна, наоборот даже хочется с каждой новой попыткой сыграть ещё лучше. Правда это касается endless moda)     В остальных уровнях (особенно в пьяных) придётся попотеть и набраться чуточку терпения. С каждым часом, проведённым в игре быстро набирается опыт прохождения того или иного круга. Нисколько не жалею потраченного времени на игру. Всем рекомендую к ознакомлению, а любителям жанра к обязательному прохождению на 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262252294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1598927910}
review:
这个简直就是转圈圈版的I wanna啊超级虐的LOL
正如另一个评测里老哥所说，目前微信里有个小游戏玩法比较类似，不过平心而论，还是这款更有意思，下面会说理由。
游戏一共有十关，4个普通关卡，难度层层迭加，每关都比前一关多一种机关，还有四个由普通关卡衍生出来的鬼畜关卡，最后是无线模式以及无限模式的鬼畜版。顺带一提，关卡从一开始就可以随意选择，无需过关解锁。
相比微信小游戏，这个游戏的前四关类似于教学，虽然没有什么文字，却能很好的[strike] 劝退 [/strike]  [strike] 调教 [/strike] 教导玩家，顺便还能解锁成就，美滋滋。而微信小游戏只有无限模式而且玩法极其单调。
技巧与I wanna系列类似，简单的地方靠反应和意识，难的地方就多死几次掌握住节奏，因为普通关卡所有东西都是固定的，有时候觉得自己在玩音乐游戏hhh，无限模式就完全靠反应了，我应该是没法拿到最后一个过100个圈的成就了。
总的来说还是一个值得挑战一下的小游戏，嘛，祝君好运 o(*￣▽￣*)ブ

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306697', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 617, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1515329239}
review:
[b]A "hardcore minimal arcade game" as the Steam Store page says.[/b] I don't know how to pronounce the name.

The only controls are the spacebar and LMB, but they both do the same thing so it's just up to preference on which you want to use.
There's no real resolution support for the game. The only good way to play is on fullscreen because using ALT + ENTER makes the window the same resolution as your set native resolution.

The game's as minimal as it's stated. The premise for the entirety of the game is just to move a dot from one circle to another without the dot running into anything. You do this until you reach the last circle that clears the level. Being arcade-y, it's also a short game with only 8 levels, but 4 of those levels are just psychidelically higher difficulty versions of the other 4, so really there's only actually 4 levels, and all these can be finished quick if you're good. 
There's an "Endless mode" but that's really all it is, an endless version of the game that you can try to get a better score at.

Watching any video of this game, especially the ones on the store page here, will tell you exactly what the game is like.
It's small in file size, cheap in price, short, pretty fun, and a little tough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097714638', 'num_games_owned': 1624, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1519655067}
review:
Recommended with a grain of salt. The levels are well-designed and require a lot of precision timing, especially towards the end. The endless mode gets challenging really quickly.
But if you've ever played a rhythm game or are even vaguely aware of the rhythm in electronic music, I highly recommend you mute it. Don't get me wrong, the music isn't bad, and it fits the art style. But it is almost never in sync with the rhythm that many sections of the game demand - it will tend to throw your timing off where you need it most.
Also, I had problems with collision detection on the last section of a level which made it (more) impossible to complete, but thankfully after restarting the game I was able to continue from the same save point and it was working again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113869642', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1521348987}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996964816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1511801350}
review:
On the one hand its a great game. On the other it might be consider some form of illegal torture...

More genuinely, Id be tempted to give it a neutral if the option existed because this gets pretty ludicrously tough. The first two levels are difficult, the wobbly modes certainly ramp that up, but then you get to the third and realise that they were practically tutorials.

The third level just keeps going on, and on, its much longer, much much tougher and about half way through had the 9 rings, 9 leaps in a row you have to get perfect, no space for rest, you cant even repeat a ring, as you die if you miss it the first time round. The timing for each ring is slightly different, each ring is done in less than a second, and most require additional jumps to dodge spikes. That one section not only cost me more lives than the first two levels combined, it cost me about ten fold the lives of the first two levels combined. It was beyond what was physically possible for me to react to, I ended up memorising the timings to the point where I was just tapping out a rhythm without even really responding directly to whats on screen. I ended up finishing level 3 on about 1000 lives lost... 
Ive not yet finished the fourth level.

Obviously something about this keeps me engaged to have such stupid levels of persistence, but it does tread a very fine line between seriously challenging, and essentially impossible for an average player to accomplish without blind luck.

Long story short, good game, worth the cost, but makes super hexagon feel effortless by comparison.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367102204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1591706979}
review:
也玩了这么久了，我就简单分享一下心得体会：
以为一开始是买的捆绑包嘛，也不知道那十几个游戏具体是什么（只知道一两个吧，只知道喜加一）
过了两天去看看发现只有五款支持中文（其实压根就没有，只是操作特别简单，摸索摸索就好了）
玩第一关嘛就熟悉一下操作，然后开始第二关，也不难，到后面就很惊喜的发现那个泡泡，咦~蛮有意思
到后面嘛，就通过缩小直径然后增加各种规则式机关，不规则式机关，反正可玩性还可以
然后一般我都是每次玩十几二十分钟，我一般以为玩了个把钟的感觉，其实不是很消磨时间
总结一下经验吧   “全凭肌肉记忆”  嗯。

author: {'steamid': '76561198071571090', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1691577960}
review:
Completely perfect, endless replay ability and not one ounce of fat. Here you wont find any stupid tutorials because the game is simple and its creator treats you like you have got a head on your shoulders (which not many games do these days) 
oO is a game that will test the limites of anyone and push them over it. To any gamer out there who thinks they are hot shit I challenge thee to get to 100 on endless or even 20. 
 
In summary: great sound track, wonderful and imaginative stages and that somethin somethin which keeps you coming back for more painful pleasure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159840678', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1509718386}
review:
抖M发泄专用小游戏。
主线的四关多试[strike]死[/strike]个三五百次总能过的。[spoiler] 个人自虐历程43、80、250、462[/spoiler]

话说扭曲泡泡还是挺有创意的。但希望能有更多玩法。

至于无尽模式，安抚好你的鼠标或者空格。然后开始锻炼你的眩晕抗性吧233
and最后一个成就全球统计居然有3.4%？这不能忍啊。果断自虐[spoiler] 看着最高记录一点一点增加，满满的成就感[/spoiler]
小提示：在50步之后可以学宣传视频里在小圈里多转一圈，不然真的反应不过来。[spoiler]虽然这点是我自己摸索出来的，泣。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198112899114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1558957967}
review:
Juego de destreza pero de mecánica muy sencilla en el que tienes que pasar una bolita entre círculos pero la bolita no pasará de un círculo a otro hasta que no pase por la unión de dos círculos. La cosa se complica con el paso de las pantallas llegando a ser un juego exigente donde el ensayo y error es la única forma posible de que pases de pantalla a base de decenas de intentos. Es un juego para jugar partidas cortas pero olvidaos de este juego si vuestra intención es relajaros porque conseguireis que os ataque los nervios pues es un juego donde puedes estar cerca del final de pantalla y fastidiarla en el último momento gracias a pulsar cuando no tienes que hacerlo, es lo que tiene este juego. La idea es buena, pero su nivel de dificultad a veces hace que quiera dejarlo y no volver más...

No es mal juego sin embargo no es que lo recomiende mucho a menos que seas masoquista, en cuyo caso, puedes ir y comprarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200419142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1704679465}
review:
非常にシンプルかつ難易度の高いゲームです
ただその難易度が癖になり、熱中してしまいます。
内容は輪っかを内回りと外回りに回る玉を操作し、障害物を避けるゲームです
ただ判定が絶妙で、難しいけど慣れれば平気だけど油断しているとしんでしまう様な
悔しさと楽しさを美味い事プレイヤーに味合わせてきます
９８円と、クオリティとは裏腹に低コストなゲームなので
是非遊んでみてはいかがでしょうか？損はしないはずです。



※とある実績がとてつもなく難しいですので、コンプリートを目指すならお覚悟を。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1503285119}
review:
Tags: Casual - Twitch & Arcade
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Unity engine little arcade game with low ambitions and no Xbox360 pad support. Removed for declutter 

Clicker style game where you navigate a dot across circles. Small five minutes campaign as well as an endless mode. Does what it does okay, if you want a game where you move a dot from the inner side to the outer side of circles and move that dot from circle to circle, this game does that. However in my case it was not enough to entertain past a few minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360545583', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1502007248}
review: [h1]一开始几关还可以，玩得非常的刺激。到了后面倒数一二关，非常考验手速，后期小球会因为惯性而改变速度，特别是最小的圆圈，转动得太快了，盯着看都快成斗鸡眼了，最后放弃了，全凭运气瞎点，简直令人抓狂。总之，如果你[u]对自己的反应速度&手速有自信[/u]，[spoiler] 或者具有抖M倾向的，	[/spoiler]可以考虑入手。[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198012764995', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1500487952}
review:
It's a genuinely fun game, but it runs poorly. It seems to render entirely by CPU, so even good rigs will get a sub-60 framerate. This causes rubberbanding, where everything in the game will slow down and speed up, which kind of ruins a game about precise timing. You'll clip through spikes that were supposed to kill you, and you'll miss jumps that were timed correctly. 

The concept and levels are really good, so don't the thumbs down as a sign that it's a bad game. I just wish I could play it properly. This is exactly the kind of game I'd love, but the performance issues are too severe to be playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123717673', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1526985808}
review:
宣传片已经展现了游戏的全部内容，共四关+无尽，且各自有相对应的扭曲化关卡。最后一个成就是无尽模式100分（跳100次），对不擅长此类游戏的玩家有一定难度。游戏设计思路很棒，极简的风格很赞，音乐和背景都做的很不错。[spoiler]然而音乐与游戏节奏无关，这并不是个音游，且BGM非常单一[/spoiler]
[strike]讲道理的话这游戏很消耗鼠标，不建议使用高端鼠标游戏[/strike]
其实这就是个背板的游戏，即使操作很烂，前四关依靠背板也不怎么会卡关。而无尽模式也是八个左右一循环，情况也只有那么几种，记住了就简单多了。无尽模式的难度很大程度上来源于画面整体的旋转，70分左右时旋转速度就已经非常夸张了。
毕竟这游戏只要几块钱，买不了吃亏买不了上当，推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198089821653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1499370446}
review:
[h1]10/10[/h1]
[h1]Um ótimo arcade quase de graça[/h1]

Você tem paciência?? Ahhhh, porque você certamente irá perde-la (:

Galera, o gênero do jogo é ARCADE. Logo, para adquirir todas as conquistas, ou simplismente finalizar as 4 fases, você não precisa "pensar" e muito menos ser um gênio com 130 de QI. O jogo se baseia em concetração, cordenação motora e muita determinação para finalizá-lo!!

[b]DICA:[/b] eu sou horrível em jogos assim, então eu utilizei o efeito sonoro do jogo para criar sequências musicais (padrões curtos). 
Tirem a música do jogo e deixem só o efeito, agora escutem o som ao passar um obstáculo, e você perceberá uma formação musical. Reproduzi-la ajudará passar as fases.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001462666', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1583664887}
review:
[h1]Fun, simple, addictive, cheap[/h1]

oO is a very simple game concept, just follow the outlines, avoid obstacles, and switch circles when the time comes. The levels start easy enough but quickly become more hectic in a fashion that reminds one of a bullet hell like experience.

I would strongly recommend this game for anyone who likes Super Hexagon and similar twitch games.

review:
Initial impressions: woa.

Great music, immediat play (no controls needed to learn), and I can say that if you liked portal, you'll like this game.

Long term impressions: Will let you know. My only concern is that if the levels don't randomize then you can beat it just by temperarily learning the pattern for whatever part you're on if you're stuck; however, I haven't played enough yet to say that it is, nor that it'll be a problem.

review: I enjoy minimalist action games, and oO seemed to be just the sort of thing I'm in to.  My first 30 minutes of play weren't the funnest, but I think that was just me adapting to the game.  But ever since then, I've loved it.  It's so cheap, please, give it a go if you think there's the slightest chance this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058661936', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1492980619}
review:
oO is an arcade game where you only have 1 button to press. It's all about your reflexes and timing.
The concept is very simple, the game isn't. I don't think i'd explain the gameplay any better than the videos, they're pretty self explanatory, really. What i can say is that this game is really challenging and fun to play, you will fail, a lot. Does it matter? Not really, it's one of theses games that have a good lose mechanic where you just restart very fast right away, so you don't feel penalized when you do. (Exept when you finally beat the level and realise you died 400 times)

I am awful at this kind of games, my reflexes are bad, but i do believe they helps me getting better (eventually, maybe...?) I like i, it's simple, it works.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968214604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1595164553}
review:
Удивительная игра, которая окупает каждый потраченный на нее рубль...
Музыка, прекрасная музыка, которая задает нужный темп, не отвлекает и не раздражает. Вы просто не замечаете ее, но стоит отключить и чего-то не хватает... 
Простейшее управление - клавиша SPACE (не очень удобно, по крайне мере на моей клавиатуре) или ЛКМ... 
И наконец endless mode и достижение, требующая набрать сто очков. 
Ничего лишнего. Только ваша потная лапа, сжимающая мышь и ваша реакция. 
Если вы любите сложные игры, не пожалейте 29 рублей на этот маленький шедевр.
10 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198137866454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1496830823}
review:
你觉得自己的反应很快嘛少年？？这个游戏会刷新的你的认知！
游戏目标就是让你的蛋蛋从一个圈跳到另一个圈，期间你的蛋会以一定速度一直跑下去，是的，它停不下来。
不过你以为这游戏就这么简单，那你就错了。
游戏给你设置了很多特殊障碍，会动的触手，会伸缩的触手，都会瞬间捏爆你的蛋，所以你的精力就得非常集中（即便如此每一整关还是会挂个一百多次，真的很难！）

author: {'steamid': '76561198113665017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1491929049}
review: [i]oO[/i] is a one-button arcade game, simple in concept and extremely challenging to beat, thus making it very catching. But I must warn you that it is all about timing, about being a perfect button-clicking machine. You just need to program yourself that specific way the game wants of you; this being done, you could beat it even with the eyes closed. So, its target audience probably includes mostly robot programmers and animal trainers. There are four levels, having two levels of difficulty each, at their disposal, and also a randomized survival to check the skills gained by their fosterlings during the main game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320697751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1511274347}
review:
从来都没有觉得自己活得这么励志过！
对于那些手残的朋友而已，这款游戏是个很好的入门游戏。至少身为高位截瘫的我玩完之后，再去玩别的以前认为比较难的游戏，感觉就像高中生打小学生一样舒爽（大雾）……
对我而言这款游戏实在是太好玩了，每次都停不下来。建议玩前嗑两颗炫迈，带上耳机，开着摩的（？），注意别被公婆踹下地（？？？）！

author: {'steamid': '76561198264952703', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1660319289}
review:
當初會注意是因為突然迷上了小品類遊戲，比起其他的解謎小品，它多了不一樣的"解謎"條件。

本遊戲有四個等級的關卡，每一關卡還有進階版，加上遊戲還有所謂的"無盡模式"，可以讓你體驗不一樣的刺激。

缺點的部分雖不是很嚴重，但依舊要稍稍提一下：關卡稍嫌太少，當玩家每個關卡都玩過一遍後，會想再次回味的意念應該不高。個人認為除非真的很有興趣，否則要入手時請再三考慮。

總而來說，這是一款值得推薦的遊戲，價格也很實惠，對小品遊戲有愛好的可以購買看看（雖說介面只有英文，但並不影響遊玩）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198162201110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1487918484}
review:
간단한 미니게임이다.
굳이 설명은 필요없을 것 같고,,,
원의 접착면이 너무 정교해서 클리어가 좀 어려웠다.
모드는 총 3개이다.
노말모드
그루브 모드(원이 울렁거림)
앤들리스 모드(기록갱신용)

앤들리스 100개 원 통과 업적을 제외하면 나머지는 1시간 내외로 딸 수 있다.
단지 미션 클리어 후 다시 하고 싶지는 않은 게임.
가성비는 좋은 수준.
음악은 그저 그런 수준.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062057359', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1485100017}
review:
To preface this, I won this in a giveaway (on steamgifts)...

This is a very well executed minimalistic game, the whole premise is to move between circles using their tangents while avoid obstacles.  It is fun when you get into it but a bit frustrating at times as the camera moves oddly distracting you (which may be an actual design decision of the developer). 

If you are looking for a casual but difficult arcade game this should be right up your alley.

Overall I would give this a 9/15.  3/5 for controls, 3/5 for gameplay, and 3/5 for graphics (more for the developer pretty accurately telegraphing obstacles).

author: {'steamid': '76561198326715566', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1498119115}
review:
[h1] 极度推荐	[/h1]
作为洒家买的第5款游戏，我对这款游戏可谓是满意至极。
[list]
    [*][strike]魔性	[/strike]动听的背景音乐与死亡音效（误
    [*]内存与所需金额不大，区区80M的内存与6RMB就能玩到一款上瘾的游戏。
    [*]强迫症福利。
[/list]
除去上述的客观因素，这款游戏的玩法十分简单：无非是用鼠标点来点去（玩法在宣传视频上已经完全展示）。但是，记住，玩了这款游戏，你的鼠标就会变成消耗品。因此，洒家在这里推荐大家使用滑动球来点击，或者是准备大堆的劣质鼠标。（？
关卡的设计非常巧妙，循序渐进不会出现一个谜题没有见过的情况。刚开始第一关笔者总共Die了222次。。还以为不能退出。。
总之，这是一款非常适合用来打发时间的小游戏。6块 也不贵，为何不来喜+1呢？
                         (手动分界线）
 2017.2.8               哇哇哇打到第三关楞死也打不过去了！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198119856138', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1630836683}
review:
いつの間にか実績来ていたので、100%ついでにレビューも

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/221640/]SuperHexagon[/url]や[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/293900/]Pivvot[/url]のような一発即死ゲーです。

ゲーム性としてはエンドレスとそれ以外に分かれてまずが、基本的にパターン毎のリズムを覚えていく感じだと思います。
割と円から円に移るのがシビアなのでよくミスをやらかしました

ステージはチェックポイント制なので、ちょっとした時間でもプレイ出来るが良心的です。
ぐにゃぐにゃするステージは…お好みで

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197984888789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1485954168}
review:
Невероятно интересная, сложная, азартная и заплетающая нервы в узел игра. На первом раунде мне понадобилось умереть больше ста раз, чтобы пройти. На третьем раунде - 950. Девятьсот пятьдесят раз умереть, чтобы пройти! Мясной парень нервно курит в сторонке)))...
Всего четыре или пять раундов и это хорошо, иначе я зажарю свой мозг и сломаю свою мышь. Управление мышью или пробелом, одним пальцем. Всё просто - надо перепрыгивать из кружочка в кружочек. Реально очень просто. Пока не появляются шипы, движущиеся шипы, выдвигающиеся шипы, перемещающиеся шипы. А чекпоинты отнюдь не в каждом колечке...

Категорически рекомендуется.
+ Интересно
+ Сложно, но выполнимо
+ Динамично

- Музыка шлак - выключайте (вместе со звуком, который к третьему раунду будет убивать вас) и ставьте что-то атомное на свой вкус - зажигательный металл, адская электроника - что угодно, но не это унылое невесть что.
- Надо реально быть упрямым человеком, чтобы играть в это.
- Таки короткая: пол игры за полтора часа. Вторая половина ясно пройдёт дольше, но всё же в 4-5 часов я точно уложусь в итоге. Наверное.

Ах да - ещё там есть бонус с кривыми уровнями. Но это жесть...

Удачи и да прибудет с вами стальная задница, вечная мышь и три запасных клавы...
9 съедобных колечек с творогом из 10...

author: {'steamid': '76561197997555429', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1488851360}
review:
A tough-as-nails, no-nonsense challenge in the same vein as Super Hexagon.  Only one button, but the game requires hair-trigger timing.  It comes down to finding a rhythm for each section.

There are only 4 levels (plus endless mode and drunk mode), but each is fiendishly difficult and brilliantly designed.  The levels are impossibly long, but you don't have to complete them in one shot; the game saves your progress at each checkpoint even if you exit the game.  (I wish I had known this before attempting level 3.  I did it in one sitting because I was afraid I'd lose my precious progress if I took a break!)

Apart from one little detail, nothing is unfair.  It's all about finding a rhythm of button-pressing.

This is a wonderful challenge, so why aren't more people talking about it?  Well, oO is a game about watching a circle spinning around and around inside other circles, which may also be spinning and may contain objects rotating in the opposite direction to your spinning!  It can cause hypnosis and nausea if you stare at it too long.

That little unfair detail: the tiny circles.  You spin so fast inside them it's impossible to see when to push the button to flip into the next circle, meaning it comes down to luck.  Not impossible, but frustrating, and there aren't too many of those moments to break the deal for me.

Highly recommended for those who want something to challenge their reflexes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326367372', 'num_games_owned': 805, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1630239240}

author: {'steamid': '76561198280371208', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1484914611}
review:
oO seems like a really easily game that won't last, but it is much more. It may be only a dot, circles, and spikes but a lot of complexity was put into making this. You're just a dot going through circles, trying to get to the end and escape. However, spikes come in your way along your way as you try to not die by missing the entry to another circle. Through four levels, this changes up, causing you to not only rely on how fast you can go but how you analyze the situation. Is it now or the next rotation that allows you to safely get past spikes? 

oO can be frusturating at times, but trial and error becomes key towards the later levels. A death count is constantly up, beign a score that you can try to lower as you gain experience with the game. Want a more difficult level? Or just bored of seeing the same circles over and over? An extra "drunk" level comes with each level, not needed to complete the game but if the player wants to. With an addition of an endless mode, oO can last for a long time. 

I appreciate how the developer didn't make achievements for not dying in each level. Normally this would be the case, but it's great seeing a game without this asthe levels are truely hard to beat without dying. For the low price it is now, I highly recommend oO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358367235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1484815219}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2465, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1483527139}
review:
빙글빙글 도는 게임.

플레이어는 작은 공입니다.
속이 빈 원을 빙글빙글 돌면서 키를 누르면 밖과 안을 오갈 수 있습니다.
원들은 크고 작은 것들이 서로 특정 지점이 겹쳐져 연결되어있으며, 
타이밍 맞춰서 원과 원 사이를 이동할 수 있죠.
그러면서 마지막 원으로 가면 클리어.

가운데 작은 원이 있는 곳은 세이브 포인트 입니다.
원에는 이동을 방해하는 가시들도 듬성듬성 등장하기에 
밖과 안을 빠르게 오고가야 하는 경우도 존재하죠.
스테이지를 클리어하면 흐믈흐믈거리는 스테이지 플레이 가능.

review:
독특한 게임제목과 뛰어난 가성비...
할인세일을 할때 사는 것이 좋습니다. 그리고 재미있지만 마지막 단계에서 어려운 장애물들이 나옵니다. 무한모드는 좀 할만하지만 계속계속 해보면 익숙해질겁니다.
특히 타이밍이 중요합니다. 무한모드에서도 중요하지만 집중을 잘 해야할거 같습니다.
어렵지만 재미있고 가격이 저렴해서 추천합니다.
7/10

review:
You know those "HARDEST GAME IN THE WORLD"-type games that aren't really hard?


This is their older sibling that is quiet with black hair and black fingernails. The one that listens to songs like "Make them Cry" and "Into the Darkness". The one that doesn't feel anything but satisfaction for the pain around them.



This game will make you rage. Embrace it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052933734', 'num_games_owned': 4633, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1479297342}
review:

連なる○を渡り歩いていくだけの死に覚えゲー｡
実質全4面＋エンドレスモード｡

トレカやSteamランキングに対応してないのは残念だが､
価格は安いし､まぁまぁ楽しめるのでおすすめ評価｡
ところで､タイトル名はなんて読めばいいんだろう？ォーオー？

author: {'steamid': '76561198134517377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1588110000}
review:
O jogo é uma merda, ele começa meio merda e depois vai ficando um pouco mais merda, mas quando chega no fim é uma merda gigantesca.
Só não gostei do "modo livre" que não tem pontos de pausa, eu não quero jogar uma merda de jogo tipo flappy byrd, mas ainda assim continua sendo uma merda.
E é bem pequeno também, nem parece um jogo terminado, não vale o que cobram, mas ainda assim continua sendo uma merda!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016747572', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1480783449}
review:
どんなゲーム？：
くっついた円同士をクリックで移り進んでいくアクションゲーム
ハイテンポなビートＢＧＭがかかるが音ゲーではなく、

チェックポイント（青く塗られた円）から円までの間に
どのようなルートで、どのようなテンポで進んでいくかを
見極めていく必要がある
特に後半にいくと円のサイズが小さくなったりトゲ（即死でちぇくポイントに戻る）
が現れたりで次のチェックポイントにいくまでに死にまくることもよくある
初見でクリアは難しく、死んで覚えるタイプ
５ステージ＋各ＥＸステージ（ぐにゃぐにゃになる）構成だが
１ステージ当たりは長めなのでじっくりと腰を据えてやりたいところ
デス数も後半にいくにつれ伸びていくだろう・・

author: {'steamid': '76561198126405404', 'num_games_owned': 1185, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1473693132}
review:
This is a pretty interesting game and at the start it is actually a lot of fun. However it quickly turns into remembering patterns and perfect timing. I also feel like there are too little checkpoints. It happens too often that I try to get through a part but it just won't happen, then I finally get through it only to die a few seconds later without ever seeing a checkpoint.

And then there is the input lag. This game is all about perfect timing. Got you timing 1% off? Too bad, try again. The problem is that there is a small amount of input lag (very small amount, that usually won't be noticable), which is really bad in this type of game.

Pros:
Good visuals
Decent soundtrack

Neutral:
Interesting game mechanics at first, but turns into frustration later

Cons:
Very frustrating
Input lag

Overall I wouldn't recommend this game (not even for this price) because of the frustration and the input lag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072065628', 'num_games_owned': 10178, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1473638072}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089299679', 'num_games_owned': 7216, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1472378933}
review:
Yes.. I like this game and I will give it thumb up. But this game really make me turn into hulk really easily. The game itself is really simple circle hooping from inside to outside but the speed of this game is very hard and you run into anything you die instantly and have to restart of check points.

Some later levels you will get a lot rings with many teeth blocking your path and a lot of them only show up at a timed interval.

It's just way to hard for me and this became one more of those rage quit game that I just have to push to the back shelf of my library to collect dust.

Not much graphics, awesome music, simple yet complicated fast paced puzzler.

8.5/10.. play and die.. ahahhahahahahahhahaha

author: {'steamid': '76561198055682656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1499815484}
review:
Too frustrating to be much fun. I do like the deceptively-simple concept and the wobbly-screen mode you can unlock each time you clear a level... but the overall charm wears off very quickly. It doesn't take long for things to start to feel mindless, and this is not the kind of game where mindless gameplay will get you anywhere.

I'm surprised at the glowing reviews this game has gotten. (And of course anyone who doesn't recommend the game gets slammed with downvotes, I'm sure I'll be no different.) Scrolling through the positive reviews, hardly any of the users seem to have played for more than a couple hours - probably because the ragequit is strong with this one; I imagine many of these people played it once and haven't touched it since - so again, it's tough to understand the positive feedback. For the novelty, sure. Everything else... hm.

Anyways - for the price, if you really want to check it out, I would say that it's worth it. There are very few games I wouldn't pay a dollar for. It's an experience, at least, and I'm not saying it's a bad game; just that I don't personally recommend going out your way for it.

[h1]TL;DR![/h1] 
If you're on the fence and clinging to your last precious dollar, then I would say just pass on this one [u]unless[/u]:
-You have exceptional reflexes
-You don't mind trial and error and error and error and trial and error
-You want achievement bragging rights, or whatever
-You like games with checkpoints that taunt the shit out of you
-You don't want hand-holding, you want a game that hates you
-You checked out the free version on kongregate and want moar

author: {'steamid': '76561198134705018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1471409744}
review:
今天终于全成就了,于是跑来写下评测...

那么要说在最前面的是:这确实是一个抖M向的游戏(....)

游戏操作很简单,全程只需要一个按键就能操作,控制着一个白色小球进进出出各种圆环
整个游戏有四个正常关卡和一个无尽关卡,以及对应每个关卡都有一个....扭曲模式.这里先吐槽下扭曲模式几乎不是人玩的,好在游戏良心没有设计这方面相关的成就欺负强迫症着实让人倍感欣慰(...)
由于只有四个关卡,所以说游戏的流程其实非常短,然而实际所需要的游戏时间却会根据你的手残程度成指数上升,即使每一关提供的存档点不算太少,后两关可能也会出现宁可怒退游戏等下次重头玩也不想继续玩下去的情况,因为真的是 难 爆 了.

关于成就,基本都是剩下一个无尽模式最后去打吧...嗯,宣传视频里的音乐就是无尽模式的音乐,也一定将会是你在游戏中听的最久的一个音乐,以及玩完了回来一看才发现,第二个视频展示的就是无尽模式的成就所需要达到的程度,然而看视频果然和自己实际玩完全不一样,正如最后一个成就的名字所写的那样:This is sick!

总之,喜欢自虐的,对自己反应能力有自信的推荐一玩,祝旋转愉快(

author: {'steamid': '76561198152760885', 'num_games_owned': 17519, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1468329195}
review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
oO has been developed and published by Maciej Targoni and Wojciech Wasiak. A seemingly simple game, yet it holds plenty of flexibility if not novelty from the arcade formula we’ve seen countless times already. The fact that it was created by a two-man team which has experience already with geometry-based gameplay mechanics, speaks volumes and assures that oO is more than just a shy debut onto Steam’s ever growing indie library.
 
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
While it may not necessarily impress with its looks, oO’s gameplay is most certainly its main attraction. Relatively short and few levels, that are well diversified through careful use of colors and obstacle shapes but quite difficult. Not entirely unexpected since the game has to stand out somehow. I never found it frustratingly hard but it does take some hefty time getting used to it. It uses the mouse controls to its advantage and can also provide a test for your own reaction time. For being a fast-paced game, it is surprisingly needy, when it comes to your required level of concentration. I consider it a nice break from other genres and as far as an affordable arcade game is concerned, this title hits all the right spots.
 
The minimal chromatic and shaping style suits the game just fine and the relaxing selection of sounds, prevents a potential attempt at rage quitting. It works as intended and you can’t complain about it at any given point.
 
[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Fun and challenging for the right price
+ Steam Achievements
 
[h1]Cons[/h1]
- No Trading Cards
 
 
[h1]Result / Final thoughts[/h1]
oO is one of those nice little games on Steam that was appropriately priced from the get-go. It features Achievements, but the inclusion of Trading Cards would have added even more sugar to this sweet deal. Does it really need more sugar to warrant a purchase? Most certainly not.
 
[b]Rating 7/10[/b]
 
[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/elitegives]Elite Giveaways[/url], check us out for more reviews ranging from Indie games to AAA titles.[/quote]

review:
하드하고 재밌습니다.

아무 생각 없이 샀는데 2시간이 그냥 지나간 게임.
난이도가 꽤나 높아 분조장이 올 수도 있습니다. 하다보면 이게 깨지네... 라는 생각이 듭니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223473928', 'num_games_owned': 2076, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1467016812}
review:
非常简单的一个小游戏，只用一个按键就能操作，宣传视频里就能看到游戏的所有玩法了。但是这里的简单并不是游戏简单的意思，是指这个游戏给你提供了一个非常简单的方法自虐。

很久以前就通关了普通关卡，但是一直有个无尽模式得100分的成就一直没有达成。

今天考试没考好，回来想发泄一下，就打开了这个游戏。在这种状态下才我轻松的达成了最后一个成就，遗憾的是损失了一个空格键。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053570068', 'num_games_owned': 1777, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1464802079}
review:
[h1]Игры такого формата не задумываясь можно отнести к категории "бесспорно шикарный минимализм".[/h1]

Это отнюдь не первый представитель жанра "хардкорная минималистичная аркада". Однако идея в случае с оО реализована идеально. Незатянутые уровни, с нарастающей сложностью, объединенные одним типом геймплея. Чекпоинты, благодаря которым игра не начинает вызывать отвращения после permadeath'ов. Бэкграунд, придающий "вкус и цвет". Ну и, конечно, Endless Mode, за который игра получает статус Хардкорщины.

10 сделанных на совесть из 10.

С уважением, badsapphire, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/steamorators]Ораторы Ste@m[/url]. [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/steamorators#curation]Куратор[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198159335738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1495958592}
review:
円の軌道に沿って●をゴールまで誘導するゲーム。
動画をみればどんなゲームかすぐわかると思います。

いたってシンプルですが、その実態は死にゲー。
タイミングを上手く合わせないとトゲにぶつかったり円の間に挟まれてぱしゅんと弾けてしまいます。
そういう意味ではちょっとリズムゲーでもあります。
サクサク死ねますがリトライもサクサク、チェックポイントがいい感じに設置されているので
全くクリアできないというわけでもないです。めっちゃDeathカウントたまりますが。

お手軽簡単かつクリアした時の達成感がしっかりある、
エンドレスモードはさらに難易度があがりますが気づくとずっとやっちゃう中毒性があります。
それでこの値段なので暇つぶしに買ってもお釣りがくるぐらい面白いゲームだと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198022044052', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1464268688}
review:
가끔 극한에 도전하는 게임들도 있지만...흥미를 못느끼게 되는걸 막아줄정도의 적당한(?)난이도와...
여러 비슷한 게임들 중에서는 꽤 재미있다고 생각합니다
어릴적 플레이하던 남극탐험에서 느끼던 분노와는 방향이 다르나 향수가 살아나는 게임이었습니다
이 게임은 너무 난이도가 높아서 거의 대다수가 깰 수 없는걸 찾으시는 분들께는 비추입니다
난이도를 5등급으로 나누자면 3.5~4등급정도니 리듬감각 있으시거나 동체시력이 좋으시고 
손도 빠르신 분들께 추천합니다
가격도 아깝지 않을정도의 시간을 보내기 충분하다고 생각합니다.

게임에 대해 설명 할 것없이 상점페이지에 소개하는 동영상만으로 충분히 느끼실 수 있을겁니다.
동영상에서 안보여주는 몇가지 것들은...
내가 할때 느껴질 빡침과 실패하면 할수록 점점 쉬운곳에서 죽게되는 어이없음...(평정이 필요합니다)
다 깼다 싶을때 날 배신하는 손가락뿐 입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073707026', 'num_games_owned': 1806, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1455491017}
review:
OoOoOoOoOoOoOoOoOoOOooooOooOOOoOOoooOo

Oo est un jeu de reflexe, ou plutot de rythme. Vous incarnez une petite boule blanche qui doit se rendre d'un point A à un point B en parcourant des cercles collés les uns aux autres tels des engrenages. 

Bien entendu ce serait trop simple et sans saveurs si le jeu se resumait à ça. Les fameux cercles seront donc, au fur et à mesure de voitre avancée, parsemés de pics immobiles ... ou non ! A vous de passer de l'exterieur à l'interieur des cercles, et vice versa, afin de les eviter. 
Bien sur c'est le type de jeu ou l'on meurt encore et encore, mais les niveaux n'etants pas aleatoires, vous allez petit à petit, apprendre les pieges et les parcours d'une maniere plutot machinale et rythmique (ceci vous obligeant à ne pas vous contenter d'avoir des reflexes, mais aussi de la mémoire et un sens du rythme de plus en plus rapide) 

Je peux avouer que le dernier niveau à été terminé plus par chance qu'autre chose... je ne sais pas encore comment j'ai reussis ... mais bon, j'ai eu une bonne étoile ! 

Un petit Must vraiment pas cher pour ceux qui aiment les petits try hard (celui ci est vraiment pas mal)

OooOOooOooOooOOOOoOOoOoOoOoOoO

author: {'steamid': '76561198275403725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1460642914}
review:
円の内側と外側を移動しながら障害物を避けてゴールを目指すシンプルなゲーム。プレイムービーを見てもらえば大体どんなゲームか分かるはず。
難易度はかなり高く、死んで覚えるタイプのゲーム。
良かった点としては、こまめにチェックポイントが用意されており、死んでも通過したチェックポイントからすぐにやり直せること。これのおかげで死んでもイライラせずにプレイすることができた。
逆に悪かった点は、ステージが少ないこと。98円のゲームなので少なくて当然だが、もう少し増やしてもらいたかった。あと、円から円に移るときの判定が少しシビアに感じた。判定はもう少し甘くても良いのではないか？
個人的には暇つぶしに最適なゲームだと思う。チェックポイントを通過すればゲームを終了しても、チェックポイントから再開出来るので空いた時間などを使って少しずつ攻略できるし、頑張ってプレイし続ければどのステージもクリア出来る。細かい不満もあるが、98円と安いので気になったら買って損はしないと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004954586', 'num_games_owned': 6094, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1452596034}
review:
I'm really not certain how to categorize this game. I suppose it's a quick reaction arcade game...
Either way it's a good pick up and play game and for the price you can't go wrong.
Watch the trailer for a few seconds and you'll know exactly what to expect. The checkpoints are well spaced to be difficult without being too frustrating.
If you want a simplistic, but well designed and responsive one-button game spend the dollar on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016251988', 'num_games_owned': 3171, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1472017668}
review:
Хардкор. Только хардкор. Нужно просто из одной О в другое О перейти в точке соприкосновения. Но скаждым новым О сложность растет. Появляются препятствия, скорость, размер и прочее. Гдето на половине первого уровня я уже начал задумываться - где же этот конец. Но после первого уровня(222 смерти) я понял что первый это были просто цветочки. Во втором все плывет и наше "О" меняет свои граници в хаотическом порядке. И я понимаю что игра будет просто мегахардкорной. Я думаю или мышь полетит в стену к концу игры, или как минимум надо будет ее чистить-ремонтировать после ритмических нажиманий. Я не зря упомянул про ритмичность, порой уже рефлекторно запоминаешь когда нужно нажать, чтобы перейти, и так по накатанной, слава богу в игре есть небольшие чекпоинты.
  Еще в игре есть бессконечный режим. Вот там должен быть просто ад. Но я до него еще не докликал.
Рекомендую любителям Хардкора.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152566369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1491196001}
review:
"oO~oO~oO~oO~oO~
It's always a good time~
oO~oO~oO~oO~oO~
It's always a good time~"
[b]作为一个强迫症抖M成就党必须要达成全成就！[/b]
[b]历经千辛万苦之后本人在于如愿以偿全成就了！[/b]
[b]下面分享一些全成就小技巧！请大家认真做笔记！[/b]
[h1]首先：[/h1]建议大家玩游戏的时候要准备很多廉价鼠标！因为鼠标是消耗品！在拼全成就的过程不是左键击穿失灵就是被愤怒的自己摔掉！所以为了不影响游戏手感，不耽误继续游戏刷连杀数，必须要多准备！
[h1]其次：[/h1]建议大家玩游戏的时候热身充分！活动好上肢肌肉！把背景音乐调成最躁的死亡重金属！喝两杯浓咖啡！嚼几瓣大蒜！完全清醒并且加强肾上腺素分泌！用人类战斗的本能来决定一瞬间的胜负！
[h1]最后：[/h1]如果在游戏的期间陷入的瓶颈而久久不能平静时，就要放大招了！先灌自己两斤烧刀子！做一百个俯卧撑和深蹲跳！有条件的话找平时看不爽的人茬一架或者情侣之间临时分个手之类的！争取把自己搞的头晕目眩欲仙欲死的！这样的你的视觉就和游戏画面晃动的频率一致了！现在你有如天神附体！全成就变得so easy~
[strike][b]前面是一本正经的胡说八道。[/b][/strike]想要通关并且全成就只能苦练。死的次数多了自然水到渠成！游戏打分8/10！扣一分是因为没有设置卡片掉落。再扣一分是说明oO这款游戏还有进步的空间！

author: {'steamid': '76561198057918945', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1648592885}
review:
oO is a fun little game totally worth the 99 cents.

All you have to do is to lead a small white sphere from a ball to another while avoiding spikes. First stage is quite easy but at later levels things such as moving spikes and timed spikes (they disappear and reappear in a certain pattern).

After beating a level you can try a twisted version of it where everything is wobbly and non-circular.

Endless mode is quite fun and is randomized every try. You can get a super lucky run and easily get 100 points or you can get a super hard run and have trouble getting 6 points.

Oh, and fourth level will destroy you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083656207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1545900971}
review:
小丽想找一个稳重有耐心的男朋友，因为她知道自己脾气不好不太好，没耐心，时不时会小作一下，一般的男孩子都受不了。谈了几个男生都因为这些问题没多久就分手了。于是她便来找智慧与光的化身谛听哥哥，请教他该怎么办。
“让他来玩《Oo》吧！玩不了《Oo》的男人，你也用不着和他Xx！”
于是在谛听哥哥的帮chuan助jiao下，小丽成为了斯婷姆的荣誉会员。每当认识一个新男孩的时候，都会推荐他来玩一下《Oo》，看看这个男生能否理解包容自己。
有一个男生外表温文尔雅，某日小丽让他玩《Oo》，结果一关还未结束，这个男生就开始破口大骂，表情抽搐，差点把小丽的电脑给砸了。小丽实在看不下去说别玩了，该男生就才摸了摸已经竖起来的头发，恢复平静的表情说。“宝贝，我们去吃饭好不好。”
于是就没有然后了。
接连几次下来，小丽很沮丧。又来找热情与爱的化身谛听哥哥。
谛听看着泫然欲泣的小丽，摸了摸她的脑袋说：
“别灰心，你肯定能找到一个包容你理解你，懂你的男孩子的的。”然后他若无其事地说：
“小丽你看我《Oo》已经全成就了唉。”

author: {'steamid': '76561198124184364', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1454781276}
review:
oO - это хардкорная минималистичная игра, в которой нам предстоит играть за белый шарик. Мы должны просто-напросто вращаться внутри или снаружи круга, попутно уворачиваясь от препятствий. Как всё просто звучит, правда?

Плюсы :
+ Минималистичная графика, в которой нет ничего лишнего.
+ Плюс за хардкорность. Первые три основные уровня относительно лёгкие, а вот четвёртый даст пропотеться даже заядлому хардкорщику!
+ Залипательный геймплей. Из игры не хочется выходить, но я вынужден был выходить, чтобы не разъ*бать дорогую клавиатуру :)
+ Скромное музыкальное сопровождение, которое вносит в игру свою изюминку.

Минусы :
- Мне не понравилось отсутствие сюжета или хотя бы какого-то наставления от разработчиков. Хотелось какую-нибудь анимацию в конце игры или слова "Ты сделал это, парень!". Но, к сожалению, такого не было.

Оценка: 7,0/10

P.S. любителям хардкорчика рекомендуется!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035285721', 'num_games_owned': 5118, 'num_reviews': 1098, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1455027350}
review:
[h1]"Spikes and Circles"[/h1]
Ingenious quick reaction game. You are a dot running in circles and can swap from the inside to the outside border of the circle. That point where two circles touch you can intercept to the next circles. Apparently there are spikes added in higher levels. So the game becomes quite challenging in the end. Especially the endless mode. But that's what I like.

review:
在别人的机器上玩过，于是我steam也买一个玩玩。
玩到后面游戏有点不太人性化，感觉都已经不是给人玩的了，绿色那关尖刺的移动速度根本就是反人类的，只能通过多次尝试总结点击时机才能玩下去。。。
不过endlessmode倒是还可以，暂时最佳成绩是52.感觉endlessmode玩多了其他模式可以飞速进步啊。
因为是打折的时候入的，只需要3块钱。
评价7/10
